comment: He doesn't curve at all - including the ACS final. He sometimes does an online quiz for added points to the test. Gives extremely mixed signals and doesn't communicate well. I went to his office hours. He wasn't there. Next class I asked him about it - he says not to come and ask during class. 3 weeks later - berates the class for not coming to OH.

He cares a lot about the topics he teaches and treats his students as equals. He also takes feedback when deciding test dates or lab activities. Highly recommend you take him for forensic chem or a Special topic course if you can. His lectures are slow and sometimes end early, but I still learned all I needed for the labs and tests. Very helpful!

Save yourself and DO NOT take his class. He is an equivocator and fabricator who talks in circles, does not adhere to his syllabus, and has indirect lecture notes and confusing explanations. Also, his lecture notes and answer keys completely contradict the textbook, homework, assignments, and the own exam he wrote.

Dr. Msimanga's lectures are hard to keep up with; Also, for one of the problem sets, a question had a wrong answer and he said, "Don't study the wrong material" (Everyone ended up failing that exam). Additionally, he curves exams because everyone fails them. He doesn't respond to emails, either. I would not in good conscience recommend taking him.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Avoid him at all costs. He is really confusing and when you go to his office hours, he is either not there or only has 5 minutes. He would mark incorrect answers as the correct ones on the problem set and then when we asked him about it instead of correcting it he'd say 'don't study wrong material'. Curves the test a lot because everyone fails its.

DO NOT TAKE HIM. He has more than half the class failing and I dropped out of his class. He doesn't curve grades even if class average is 50%. In both his exams so far he had 60% and 50% as class average. His class lectures are confusing and I had to teach myself after class to get the concepts.

Dr. Msimanga is not a great professor at all. On test two, not a single student got an A or a B, maybe five students got Cs and everyone else failed out of 72 students across two sections. If you can avoid him, I would strongly recommend doing so. He doesn't like answering questions either, and will not respond if you email him.

His lectures are kind of hard to understand; I feel like I learned just as much whether I went to class or not. He was not willing to engage with students or answer questions in any meaningful way. His test averages are far below what other professors' averages were.

He was not effective in teaching the content. You need to go to class to learn the content but at the same time, even when you go to class he is very slow at moving through the content and not easy to understand his teaching. He has an accent so you need to pay attention closely at some points. Steer clear if possible but if you cant, he's okay.

This professor is an amazing teacher, though he has a thick accent. He gives students material they can use to review for tests and gives extra credit. Attend the class though because if you miss one class, while there are PowerPoints, you would not be able to understand the material being taught in class or would be on the exam.

He graded labs harshly. Final exam has many questions from other lecture classes, questions you wouldn't be able to answer if you only took the lab so beware. He plays favorites; if you go to office hours then he'll grant you an extension, for example. If you didn't go to office hours, no extension for you. Nice in person but not when grading.

Was he an okay guy? sure, would i take him again? no. He doesn't explain well and when you have questions in class he says that you should already know this. He does not reply to emails, says he will add points if you do a test add on quiz but never does, and he didn't even post the final exam grade. If you can take someone else.

He is a funny man but I wouldn't recommend to anyone that's not confident in their chemistry skills. A lot of "you should already know this, so I'm not going over it" in lectures and basically no homework for practice. Tests are also entirely multiple choice, which means no partial credit.

Good guy and he cares about his students, but he teaches fast and doesnt explain things very well. He also puts check marks and circles around everything which can make it even more confusing when you follow him in the lectures. Be prepared to teach yourself a lot because he is too difficult to follow unless you really understand chemistry.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Super caring and funny, but tests were very difficult, wish I did more practice problems, study the problem sets because they are very similar to exercises and exams. But he does offer extra credit opportunities, so take advantage of those because you will need it. Feel like if I put more work into studying, I would have gotten an A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He's a great guy, seems to care about our grades and all but the class is just so difficult for his teaching style to be so fast. There was rarely any review & I didn't feel prepared for the ACS exam at all. Go to his office hours & study the practice problem pdf things.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy
